segment.source: Define the Project Scope
segment.target: Define the Project Scope

segment.source: Define the Project Scope
segment.target: Define the Project Scope

segment.source: Define the Project Scope
segment.target: Define the Project Scope

segment.source: When defining the project scope, determine the following:
segment.target: When defining the project scope, determine the following:

segment.source: The MED-V end users—the location and number of end users are used in determining the location of MED-V client installations and the number of MED-V instances, as well as the number and placement of MED-V image repositories.
segment.target: The MED-V end users—the location and number of end users are used in determining the location of MED-V client installations and the number of MED-V instances, as well as the number and placement of MED-V image repositories.

segment.source: The virtual machine (VM) images to be managed by MED-V—to determine the method of distributing images and placement of image repositories.
segment.target: The virtual machine (VM) images to be managed by MED-V—to determine the method of distributing images and placement of image repositories.

segment.source: The organization’s service level expectations—to determine the performance and fault-tolerance requirements for the MED-V server and database as well as the image repository.
segment.target: The organization’s service level expectations—to determine the performance and fault-tolerance requirements for the MED-V server and database as well as the image repository.

segment.source: Validate with the business—ensure there is a complete understanding of how the planned infrastructure affects the business.
segment.target: Validate with the business—ensure there is a complete understanding of how the planned infrastructure affects the business.

segment.source: Define the MED-V End Users
segment.target: Define the MED-V End Users

segment.source: First, determine where the end users are located, as well as the number of users in each location.
segment.target: First, determine where the end users are located, as well as the number of users in each location.

segment.source: Second, obtain a network infrastructure diagram that displays the user locations and the available bandwidth to those locations.
segment.target: Second, obtain a network infrastructure diagram that displays the user locations and the available bandwidth to those locations.

segment.source: Third, find out if users travel between locations.
segment.target: Third, find out if users travel between locations.

segment.source: If users travel, additional capacity may be required in the design of the server infrastructure and image repositories.
segment.target: If users travel, additional capacity may be required in the design of the server infrastructure and image repositories.

segment.source: Determine the MED-V Images to Be Managed by MED-V
segment.target: Determine the MED-V Images to Be Managed by MED-V

segment.source: After the MED-V end users have been defined, determine which VMs will be managed by MED-V for the users in each location.
segment.target: After the MED-V end users have been defined, determine which VMs will be managed by MED-V for the users in each location.

segment.source: If any of the VMs are stored in a centralized library, determine the location of the library so that it may be evaluated for use as a MED-V repository.
segment.target: If any of the VMs are stored in a centralized library, determine the location of the library so that it may be evaluated for use as a MED-V repository.

segment.source: Determine the Organization’s Service Level Expectations
segment.target: Determine the Organization’s Service Level Expectations

segment.source: For each MED-V workspace, note the acceptable time for a new image to load and the timeframe for critical updates to be deployed.
segment.target: For each MED-V workspace, note the acceptable time for a new image to load and the timeframe for critical updates to be deployed.

segment.source: If applicable, record the service level expectations for MED-V reporting, to be used in the design of the server infrastructure.
segment.target: If applicable, record the service level expectations for MED-V reporting, to be used in the design of the server infrastructure.

segment.source: Validate with the Business
segment.target: Validate with the Business

segment.source: Ask business stakeholders and application owners the following questions:
segment.target: Ask business stakeholders and application owners the following questions:

segment.source: Are there any existing images that can be combined?
segment.target: Are there any existing images that can be combined?

segment.source: For example, if application A on Windows XP is one VPC image and application B on Windows XP is another VPC image, perhaps a single image can contain both applications, thereby reducing repository space and bandwidth required for image download.
segment.target: For example, if application A on Windows XP is one VPC image and application B on Windows XP is another VPC image, perhaps a single image can contain both applications, thereby reducing repository space and bandwidth required for image download.

segment.source: Are the in-scope applications licensable and supportable if delivered in a VM by MED-V?
segment.target: Are the in-scope applications licensable and supportable if delivered in a VM by MED-V?

segment.source: Check with the application supplier to ensure that licensing and support terms will not be violated by delivering the application through MED-V.
segment.target: Check with the application supplier to ensure that licensing and support terms will not be violated by delivering the application through MED-V.
